bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the Office of Finance and Accounting of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. These materials include files from the Comptroller's office, accounting records, systems records, and files from the Office of Development. Comptroller's and accounting records date from 1909 to 1997, and include budgets, general ledgers (1909-1992), cash receipt books (1960s and 1990s), accounts of operating and special funds, payroll summaries, employee benefits information, bank statements, accounts payable and receivable, tax records, records of calendar sales, telephone usage reports, audit reports (1947-1981), and minutes and reports from the Committee on Budget and Finance. Systems records consist of files of Kevin Crawford and Margy Brumbacker and include instructions and files on telephone and voicemail systems, the computer network, accounting software, and office equipment. Records of the Office of Development include correspondence and reports related to fundraising from individual donors and institutions (with files for individuals events and projects, as well as related to overall development initiatives such as annual giving), forms related to routine functions including data entry, tracking logs, photographs from events, and printed materials from other organizations. Development records also contain materials from the Committee on Development, including meeting minutes, memoranda, agendas, and correspondence. These materials include files of Antonia Oberthaler, Monica McCray, Ben Pierce, and others. The collection also includes records of facility rentals from 1996 to 2000.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
